parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
Abstr: alms-giving, charity; concr: alms, charity. From eleos; compassionateness, i.e. beneficence, or a benefaction.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
A purse, money-bag. Probably remotely from ballo; a pouch.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To make old, declare obsolete; pass: I grow old, become obsolete. From palaios; to make worn out, or declare obsolete.
Unfailing. Not left out, i.e. inexhaustible.
A store-house for precious things; hence: a treasure, a store. From tithemi; a deposit, i.e. Wealth.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A thief. From klepto; a stealer.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
A moth. Apparently of Hebrew origin; a moth.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To destroy, waste; hence met: I corrupt. From diaballo and phtheiro; to rot thoroughly, i.e. to ruin.
